controllers.smc.algorithms.hybrid.switching_logic¶

Source: src\controllers\smc\algorithms\hybrid\switching_logic.py

Module Overview¶

Hybrid Switching Logic for Multi-Controller SMC.

Implements intelligent switching between multiple SMC controllers based on:

  • System performance metrics

  • Operating conditions

  • Predictive analysis

  • Learning algorithms

Mathematical Background:

  • Switching functions prevent controller chattering

  • Hysteresis bands ensure stable transitions

  • Performance indices guide optimal controller selection

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#============== src/controllers/smc/algorithms/hybrid/switching_logic.py ==============\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Hybrid Switching Logic for Multi-Controller SMC.
  7
  8Implements intelligent switching between multiple SMC controllers based on:
  9- System performance metrics
 10- Operating conditions
 11- Predictive analysis
 12- Learning algorithms
 13
 14Mathematical Background:
 15- Switching functions prevent controller chattering
 16- Hysteresis bands ensure stable transitions
 17- Performance indices guide optimal controller selection
 18"""
 19
 20from typing import Dict, List, Optional, Any, Tuple
 21import numpy as np
 22from collections import deque
 23from enum import Enum
 24
 25from .config import HybridSMCConfig, SwitchingCriterion
 26
 27
 28class ControllerState(Enum):
 29    """Current active controller state."""
 30    CLASSICAL = "classical"
 31    ADAPTIVE = "adaptive"
 32    SUPERTWISTING = "supertwisting"
 33
 34
 35class SwitchingDecision:
 36    """Represents a switching decision with reasoning."""
 37
 38    def __init__(self, target_controller: ControllerState, reason: str,
 39                 confidence: float, metrics: Dict[str, float]):
 40        self.target_controller = target_controller
 41        self.reason = reason
 42        self.confidence = confidence  # 0.0 to 1.0
 43        self.metrics = metrics
 44        self.timestamp = None  # Will be set by switching logic
 45
 46
 47class HybridSwitchingLogic:
 48    """
 49    Intelligent switching logic for hybrid SMC controllers.
 50
 51    Manages controller selection based on system performance,
 52    operating conditions, and learned preferences.
 53    """
 54
 55    def __init__(self, config: HybridSMCConfig):
 56        """
 57        Initialize hybrid switching logic.
 58
 59        Args:
 60            config: Hybrid SMC configuration
 61        """
 62        self.config = config
 63        self.active_controllers = config.get_active_controllers()
 64
 65        # Initialize with first available controller
 66        initial_controller = self.active_controllers[0]
 67        self.current_controller = ControllerState(initial_controller)
 68
 69        # State tracking
 70        self.last_switch_time = 0.0
 71        self.switch_history = []
 72
 73        # Performance tracking
 74        self.performance_history = {
 75            controller: deque(maxlen=config.performance_window)
 76            for controller in self.active_controllers
 77        }
 78        self.current_performance_metrics = {}
 79
 80        # Learning state (if enabled)
 81        if config.enable_learning:
 82            self.learned_thresholds = list(config.switching_thresholds)
 83            self.threshold_adaptation_history = []
 84        else:
 85            self.learned_thresholds = None
 86
 87        # Prediction state (if enabled)
 88        if config.enable_predictive_switching:
 89            self.prediction_buffer = deque(maxlen=config.prediction_horizon)
 90        else:
 91            self.prediction_buffer = None
 92
 93    def evaluate_switching(self, system_state: np.ndarray, control_results: Dict[str, Any],
 94                          current_time: float) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
 95        """
 96        Evaluate whether to switch controllers.
 97
 98        Args:
 99            system_state: Current system state
100            control_results: Results from all controllers
101            current_time: Current simulation time
102
103        Returns:
104            SwitchingDecision if switching recommended, None otherwise
105        """
106        # Check if switching is allowed based on timing
107        if not self.config.is_switching_allowed(self.last_switch_time, current_time):
108            return None
109
110        # Update performance metrics
111        self._update_performance_metrics(control_results, system_state)
112
113        # Determine switching criterion and evaluate
114        if self.config.switching_criterion == SwitchingCriterion.SURFACE_MAGNITUDE:
115            decision = self._evaluate_surface_magnitude_switching(control_results)
116        elif self.config.switching_criterion == SwitchingCriterion.CONTROL_EFFORT:
117            decision = self._evaluate_control_effort_switching(control_results)
118        elif self.config.switching_criterion == SwitchingCriterion.TRACKING_ERROR:
119            decision = self._evaluate_tracking_error_switching(system_state)
120        elif self.config.switching_criterion == SwitchingCriterion.ADAPTATION_RATE:
121            decision = self._evaluate_adaptation_rate_switching(control_results)
122        elif self.config.switching_criterion == SwitchingCriterion.PERFORMANCE_INDEX:
123            decision = self._evaluate_performance_index_switching(control_results)
124        elif self.config.switching_criterion == SwitchingCriterion.TIME_BASED:
125            decision = self._evaluate_time_based_switching(current_time)
126        else:
127            raise ValueError(f"Unknown switching criterion: {self.config.switching_criterion}")
128
129        # Apply predictive analysis if enabled
130        if decision and self.config.enable_predictive_switching:
131            decision = self._apply_predictive_analysis(decision, system_state)
132
133        # Apply learning if enabled
134        if decision and self.config.enable_learning:
135            self._update_learned_thresholds(decision, control_results)
136
137        return decision
138
139    def execute_switch(self, decision: SwitchingDecision, current_time: float) -> bool:
140        """
141        Execute a switching decision.
142
143        Args:
144            decision: Switching decision to execute
145            current_time: Current time
146
147        Returns:
148            True if switch was executed, False if prevented by hysteresis
149        """
150        # Apply hysteresis check
151        if not self._check_hysteresis_condition(decision):
152            return False
153
154        # Record switch
155        decision.timestamp = current_time
156        self.switch_history.append({
157            'time': current_time,
158            'from': self.current_controller.value,
159            'to': decision.target_controller.value,
160            'reason': decision.reason,
161            'confidence': decision.confidence,
162            'metrics': decision.metrics.copy()
163        })
164
165        # Execute switch
166        previous_controller = self.current_controller
167        self.current_controller = decision.target_controller
168        self.last_switch_time = current_time
169
170        return True
171
172    def get_current_controller(self) -> str:
173        """Get name of currently active controller."""
174        return self.current_controller.value
175
176    def _update_performance_metrics(self, control_results: Dict[str, Any], system_state: np.ndarray) -> None:
177        """Update performance metrics for all controllers."""
178        # Extract common metrics
179        metrics = {}
180
181        # Tracking error (assuming state format [x, x_dot, theta1, theta1_dot, theta2, theta2_dot])
182        if len(system_state) >= 6:
183            position_error = np.sqrt(system_state[0]**2)  # Cart position error
184            angle_errors = np.sqrt(system_state[2]**2 + system_state[4]**2)  # Joint angle errors
185            metrics['tracking_error'] = position_error + angle_errors
186        else:
187            metrics['tracking_error'] = 0.0
188
189        # Control effort
190        active_controller = self.current_controller.value
191        if active_controller in control_results:
192            metrics['control_effort'] = abs(control_results[active_controller].get('u', 0.0))
193        else:
194            metrics['control_effort'] = 0.0
195
196        # Surface magnitude
197        if active_controller in control_results:
198            metrics['surface_magnitude'] = abs(control_results[active_controller].get('surface_value', 0.0))
199        else:
200            metrics['surface_magnitude'] = 0.0
201
202        # Store current metrics
203        self.current_performance_metrics = metrics
204
205        # Update performance history for current controller
206        if active_controller in self.performance_history:
207            performance_index = self.config.compute_weighted_performance(metrics)
208            self.performance_history[active_controller].append(performance_index)
209
210    def _evaluate_surface_magnitude_switching(self, control_results: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
211        """Evaluate switching based on sliding surface magnitude."""
212        current_controller = self.current_controller.value
213
214        if current_controller not in control_results:
215            return None
216
217        surface_magnitude = abs(control_results[current_controller].get('surface_value', 0.0))
218        thresholds = self.learned_thresholds or self.config.switching_thresholds
219
220        # Determine target controller based on surface magnitude
221        if surface_magnitude > thresholds[-1]:  # High surface magnitude
222            # Switch to most aggressive controller (usually Super-Twisting or Adaptive)
223            if 'supertwisting' in self.active_controllers:
224                target = ControllerState.SUPERTWISTING
225                reason = f"High surface magnitude {surface_magnitude:.3f} > {thresholds[-1]:.3f}"
226            elif 'adaptive' in self.active_controllers:
227                target = ControllerState.ADAPTIVE
228                reason = f"High surface magnitude {surface_magnitude:.3f} > {thresholds[-1]:.3f}"
229            else:
230                return None
231
232        elif surface_magnitude < thresholds[0]:  # Low surface magnitude
233            # Switch to classical controller for efficiency
234            if 'classical' in self.active_controllers:
235                target = ControllerState.CLASSICAL
236                reason = f"Low surface magnitude {surface_magnitude:.3f} < {thresholds[0]:.3f}"
237            else:
238                return None
239
240        else:
241            # Medium range - stay with current or use adaptive
242            if 'adaptive' in self.active_controllers and current_controller != 'adaptive':
243                target = ControllerState.ADAPTIVE
244                reason = f"Medium surface magnitude {surface_magnitude:.3f}"
245            else:
246                return None
247
248        if target.value == current_controller:
249            return None
250
251        # Calculate confidence based on how far from threshold
252        distance_from_threshold = min(
253            abs(surface_magnitude - thresh) for thresh in thresholds
254        )
255        max_distance = max(thresholds) - min(thresholds)
256        confidence = min(1.0, distance_from_threshold / max_distance)
257
258        return SwitchingDecision(
259            target_controller=target,
260            reason=reason,
261            confidence=confidence,
262            metrics={'surface_magnitude': surface_magnitude}
263        )
264
265    def _evaluate_control_effort_switching(self, control_results: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
266        """Evaluate switching based on control effort."""
267        current_controller = self.current_controller.value
268
269        if current_controller not in control_results:
270            return None
271
272        control_effort = abs(control_results[current_controller].get('u', 0.0))
273        effort_threshold = self.config.max_force * 0.8  # 80% of max force
274
275        if control_effort > effort_threshold:
276            # High control effort - switch to smoother controller
277            if 'classical' in self.active_controllers and current_controller != 'classical':
278                target = ControllerState.CLASSICAL
279                reason = f"High control effort {control_effort:.3f} > {effort_threshold:.3f}"
280                confidence = min(1.0, (control_effort - effort_threshold) / (self.config.max_force - effort_threshold))
281
282                return SwitchingDecision(
283                    target_controller=target,
284                    reason=reason,
285                    confidence=confidence,
286                    metrics={'control_effort': control_effort}
287                )
288
289        return None
290
291    def _evaluate_tracking_error_switching(self, system_state: np.ndarray) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
292        """Evaluate switching based on tracking error."""
293        tracking_error = self.current_performance_metrics.get('tracking_error', 0.0)
294        error_threshold = 0.1  # Configurable threshold
295
296        if tracking_error > error_threshold:
297            # High tracking error - switch to more aggressive controller
298            current_controller = self.current_controller.value
299
300            if 'supertwisting' in self.active_controllers and current_controller != 'supertwisting':
301                target = ControllerState.SUPERTWISTING
302            elif 'adaptive' in self.active_controllers and current_controller != 'adaptive':
303                target = ControllerState.ADAPTIVE
304            else:
305                return None
306
307            reason = f"High tracking error {tracking_error:.3f} > {error_threshold:.3f}"
308            confidence = min(1.0, tracking_error / (2 * error_threshold))
309
310            return SwitchingDecision(
311                target_controller=target,
312                reason=reason,
313                confidence=confidence,
314                metrics={'tracking_error': tracking_error}
315            )
316
317        return None
318
319    def _evaluate_adaptation_rate_switching(self, control_results: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
320        """Evaluate switching based on adaptation rate (for adaptive controllers)."""
321        current_controller = self.current_controller.value
322
323        if current_controller == 'adaptive' and 'adaptive' in control_results:
324            adaptation_rate = control_results['adaptive'].get('adaptation_rate', 0.0)
325            high_adaptation_threshold = 10.0  # Configurable
326
327            if adaptation_rate > high_adaptation_threshold:
328                # High adaptation rate indicates uncertainty - might switch to Super-Twisting
329                if 'supertwisting' in self.active_controllers:
330                    target = ControllerState.SUPERTWISTING
331                    reason = f"High adaptation rate {adaptation_rate:.3f}"
332                    confidence = min(1.0, adaptation_rate / (2 * high_adaptation_threshold))
333
334                    return SwitchingDecision(
335                        target_controller=target,
336                        reason=reason,
337                        confidence=confidence,
338                        metrics={'adaptation_rate': adaptation_rate}
339                    )
340
341        return None
342
343    def _evaluate_performance_index_switching(self, control_results: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
344        """Evaluate switching based on comprehensive performance index."""
345        current_controller = self.current_controller.value
346
347        # Calculate performance for each available controller
348        controller_performances = {}
349        for controller_name in self.active_controllers:
350            if controller_name in self.performance_history and len(self.performance_history[controller_name]) > 5:
351                recent_performance = list(self.performance_history[controller_name])[-5:]
352                controller_performances[controller_name] = np.mean(recent_performance)
353
354        if len(controller_performances) < 2:
355            return None
356
357        # Find best performing controller
358        best_controller = min(controller_performances.keys(), key=lambda k: controller_performances[k])
359        current_performance = controller_performances.get(current_controller, float('inf'))
360        best_performance = controller_performances[best_controller]
361
362        # Switch if another controller is significantly better
363        improvement_threshold = 0.1  # 10% improvement needed
364        if (best_controller != current_controller and
365            current_performance > best_performance * (1 + improvement_threshold)):
366
367            target = ControllerState(best_controller)
368            improvement = (current_performance - best_performance) / current_performance
369            reason = f"Performance improvement {improvement:.2%} by switching to {best_controller}"
370            confidence = min(1.0, improvement / 0.5)  # Cap at 50% improvement
371
372            return SwitchingDecision(
373                target_controller=target,
374                reason=reason,
375                confidence=confidence,
376                metrics={'performance_improvement': improvement}
377            )
378
379        return None
380
381    def _evaluate_time_based_switching(self, current_time: float) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
382        """Evaluate switching based on time (round-robin or scheduled switching)."""
383        # Simple round-robin switching every 2 seconds
384        switching_period = 2.0
385        controller_index = int(current_time / switching_period) % len(self.active_controllers)
386        target_controller_name = self.active_controllers[controller_index]
387
388        if target_controller_name != self.current_controller.value:
389            target = ControllerState(target_controller_name)
390            reason = f"Time-based switching at t={current_time:.1f}s"
391            confidence = 1.0
392
393            return SwitchingDecision(
394                target_controller=target,
395                reason=reason,
396                confidence=confidence,
397                metrics={'switching_time': current_time}
398            )
399
400        return None
401
402    def _check_hysteresis_condition(self, decision: SwitchingDecision) -> bool:
403        """Check if switching decision passes hysteresis condition."""
404        # Simple hysteresis: require high confidence for switching
405        return decision.confidence > 0.6
406
407    def _apply_predictive_analysis(self, decision: SwitchingDecision, system_state: np.ndarray) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
408        """Apply predictive analysis to switching decision."""
409        # Store current state for prediction
410        if self.prediction_buffer is not None:
411            self.prediction_buffer.append({
412                'state': system_state.copy(),
413                'metrics': self.current_performance_metrics.copy(),
414                'decision': decision
415            })
416
417        # Simple prediction: only switch if trend supports it
418        if len(self.prediction_buffer) >= 3:
419            recent_metrics = [entry['metrics'].get('surface_magnitude', 0)
420                            for entry in list(self.prediction_buffer)[-3:]]
421
422            # Check if trend supports switching decision
423            if decision.target_controller == ControllerState.SUPERTWISTING:
424                # Expect increasing surface magnitude trend
425                trend = np.polyfit(range(len(recent_metrics)), recent_metrics, 1)[0]
426                if trend <= 0:  # Decreasing trend, don't switch to aggressive controller
427                    return None
428            elif decision.target_controller == ControllerState.CLASSICAL:
429                # Expect decreasing surface magnitude trend
430                trend = np.polyfit(range(len(recent_metrics)), recent_metrics, 1)[0]
431                if trend >= 0:  # Increasing trend, don't switch to gentle controller
432                    return None
433
434        return decision
435
436    def _update_learned_thresholds(self, decision: SwitchingDecision, control_results: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
437        """Update learned switching thresholds based on decision outcomes."""
438        if not self.config.enable_learning or self.learned_thresholds is None:
439            return
440
441        # Simple learning: adjust thresholds based on switching success
442        # This would require feedback on switching outcome quality
443        # For now, just record the decision for future analysis
444        self.threshold_adaptation_history.append({
445            'decision': decision,
446            'thresholds': self.learned_thresholds.copy(),
447            'metrics': self.current_performance_metrics.copy()
448        })
449
450    def get_switching_analysis(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
451        """Get comprehensive analysis of switching behavior."""
452        return {
453            'current_controller': self.current_controller.value,
454            'switch_history': self.switch_history[-10:],  # Last 10 switches
455            'performance_history': {
456                controller: list(history)[-20:]  # Last 20 entries
457                for controller, history in self.performance_history.items()
458            },
459            'switching_statistics': self._compute_switching_statistics(),
460            'learned_thresholds': self.learned_thresholds,
461            'configuration': {
462                'criterion': self.config.switching_criterion.value,
463                'thresholds': self.config.switching_thresholds,
464                'hysteresis_margin': self.config.hysteresis_margin,
465                'min_switching_time': self.config.min_switching_time
466            }
467        }
468
469    def _compute_switching_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
470        """Compute statistics about switching behavior."""
471        if not self.switch_history:
472            return {'total_switches': 0}
473
474        # Count switches by controller
475        switch_counts = {}
476        for switch in self.switch_history:
477            from_controller = switch['from']
478            to_controller = switch['to']
479
480            key = f"{from_controller}_to_{to_controller}"
481            switch_counts[key] = switch_counts.get(key, 0) + 1
482
483        # Time between switches
484        switch_times = [switch['time'] for switch in self.switch_history]
485        if len(switch_times) > 1:
486            time_intervals = [switch_times[i+1] - switch_times[i]
487                            for i in range(len(switch_times)-1)]
488            avg_switch_interval = np.mean(time_intervals)
489            std_switch_interval = np.std(time_intervals)
490        else:
491            avg_switch_interval = 0.0
492            std_switch_interval = 0.0
493
494        return {
495            'total_switches': len(self.switch_history),
496            'switch_counts': switch_counts,
497            'avg_switch_interval': avg_switch_interval,
498            'std_switch_interval': std_switch_interval,
499            'most_recent_switch': self.switch_history[-1] if self.switch_history else None
500        }

1class ControllerState(Enum):
2    """Current active controller state."""
3    CLASSICAL = "classical"
4    ADAPTIVE = "adaptive"
5    SUPERTWISTING = "supertwisting"

SwitchingDecision¶

Represents a switching decision with reasoning.

Source Code¶

 1class SwitchingDecision:
 2    """Represents a switching decision with reasoning."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self, target_controller: ControllerState, reason: str,
 5                 confidence: float, metrics: Dict[str, float]):
 6        self.target_controller = target_controller
 7        self.reason = reason
 8        self.confidence = confidence  # 0.0 to 1.0
 9        self.metrics = metrics
10        self.timestamp = None  # Will be set by switching logic

HybridSwitchingLogic¶

Intelligent switching logic for hybrid SMC controllers.

Manages controller selection based on system performance, operating conditions, and learned preferences.

Source Code¶

  1class HybridSwitchingLogic:
  2    """
  3    Intelligent switching logic for hybrid SMC controllers.
  4
  5    Manages controller selection based on system performance,
  6    operating conditions, and learned preferences.
  7    """
  8
  9    def __init__(self, config: HybridSMCConfig):
 10        """
 11        Initialize hybrid switching logic.
 12
 13        Args:
 14            config: Hybrid SMC configuration
 15        """
 16        self.config = config
 17        self.active_controllers = config.get_active_controllers()
 18
 19        # Initialize with first available controller
 20        initial_controller = self.active_controllers[0]
 21        self.current_controller = ControllerState(initial_controller)
 22
 23        # State tracking
 24        self.last_switch_time = 0.0
 25        self.switch_history = []
 26
 27        # Performance tracking
 28        self.performance_history = {
 29            controller: deque(maxlen=config.performance_window)
 30            for controller in self.active_controllers
 31        }
 32        self.current_performance_metrics = {}
 33
 34        # Learning state (if enabled)
 35        if config.enable_learning:
 36            self.learned_thresholds = list(config.switching_thresholds)
 37            self.threshold_adaptation_history = []
 38        else:
 39            self.learned_thresholds = None
 40
 41        # Prediction state (if enabled)
 42        if config.enable_predictive_switching:
 43            self.prediction_buffer = deque(maxlen=config.prediction_horizon)
 44        else:
 45            self.prediction_buffer = None
 46
 47    def evaluate_switching(self, system_state: np.ndarray, control_results: Dict[str, Any],
 48                          current_time: float) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
 49        """
 50        Evaluate whether to switch controllers.
 51
 52        Args:
 53            system_state: Current system state
 54            control_results: Results from all controllers
 55            current_time: Current simulation time
 56
 57        Returns:
 58            SwitchingDecision if switching recommended, None otherwise
 59        """
 60        # Check if switching is allowed based on timing
 61        if not self.config.is_switching_allowed(self.last_switch_time, current_time):
 62            return None
 63
 64        # Update performance metrics
 65        self._update_performance_metrics(control_results, system_state)
 66
 67        # Determine switching criterion and evaluate
 68        if self.config.switching_criterion == SwitchingCriterion.SURFACE_MAGNITUDE:
 69            decision = self._evaluate_surface_magnitude_switching(control_results)
 70        elif self.config.switching_criterion == SwitchingCriterion.CONTROL_EFFORT:
 71            decision = self._evaluate_control_effort_switching(control_results)
 72        elif self.config.switching_criterion == SwitchingCriterion.TRACKING_ERROR:
 73            decision = self._evaluate_tracking_error_switching(system_state)
 74        elif self.config.switching_criterion == SwitchingCriterion.ADAPTATION_RATE:
 75            decision = self._evaluate_adaptation_rate_switching(control_results)
 76        elif self.config.switching_criterion == SwitchingCriterion.PERFORMANCE_INDEX:
 77            decision = self._evaluate_performance_index_switching(control_results)
 78        elif self.config.switching_criterion == SwitchingCriterion.TIME_BASED:
 79            decision = self._evaluate_time_based_switching(current_time)
 80        else:
 81            raise ValueError(f"Unknown switching criterion: {self.config.switching_criterion}")
 82
 83        # Apply predictive analysis if enabled
 84        if decision and self.config.enable_predictive_switching:
 85            decision = self._apply_predictive_analysis(decision, system_state)
 86
 87        # Apply learning if enabled
 88        if decision and self.config.enable_learning:
 89            self._update_learned_thresholds(decision, control_results)
 90
 91        return decision
 92
 93    def execute_switch(self, decision: SwitchingDecision, current_time: float) -> bool:
 94        """
 95        Execute a switching decision.
 96
 97        Args:
 98            decision: Switching decision to execute
 99            current_time: Current time
100
101        Returns:
102            True if switch was executed, False if prevented by hysteresis
103        """
104        # Apply hysteresis check
105        if not self._check_hysteresis_condition(decision):
106            return False
107
108        # Record switch
109        decision.timestamp = current_time
110        self.switch_history.append({
111            'time': current_time,
112            'from': self.current_controller.value,
113            'to': decision.target_controller.value,
114            'reason': decision.reason,
115            'confidence': decision.confidence,
116            'metrics': decision.metrics.copy()
117        })
118
119        # Execute switch
120        previous_controller = self.current_controller
121        self.current_controller = decision.target_controller
122        self.last_switch_time = current_time
123
124        return True
125
126    def get_current_controller(self) -> str:
127        """Get name of currently active controller."""
128        return self.current_controller.value
129
130    def _update_performance_metrics(self, control_results: Dict[str, Any], system_state: np.ndarray) -> None:
131        """Update performance metrics for all controllers."""
132        # Extract common metrics
133        metrics = {}
134
135        # Tracking error (assuming state format [x, x_dot, theta1, theta1_dot, theta2, theta2_dot])
136        if len(system_state) >= 6:
137            position_error = np.sqrt(system_state[0]**2)  # Cart position error
138            angle_errors = np.sqrt(system_state[2]**2 + system_state[4]**2)  # Joint angle errors
139            metrics['tracking_error'] = position_error + angle_errors
140        else:
141            metrics['tracking_error'] = 0.0
142
143        # Control effort
144        active_controller = self.current_controller.value
145        if active_controller in control_results:
146            metrics['control_effort'] = abs(control_results[active_controller].get('u', 0.0))
147        else:
148            metrics['control_effort'] = 0.0
149
150        # Surface magnitude
151        if active_controller in control_results:
152            metrics['surface_magnitude'] = abs(control_results[active_controller].get('surface_value', 0.0))
153        else:
154            metrics['surface_magnitude'] = 0.0
155
156        # Store current metrics
157        self.current_performance_metrics = metrics
158
159        # Update performance history for current controller
160        if active_controller in self.performance_history:
161            performance_index = self.config.compute_weighted_performance(metrics)
162            self.performance_history[active_controller].append(performance_index)
163
164    def _evaluate_surface_magnitude_switching(self, control_results: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
165        """Evaluate switching based on sliding surface magnitude."""
166        current_controller = self.current_controller.value
167
168        if current_controller not in control_results:
169            return None
170
171        surface_magnitude = abs(control_results[current_controller].get('surface_value', 0.0))
172        thresholds = self.learned_thresholds or self.config.switching_thresholds
173
174        # Determine target controller based on surface magnitude
175        if surface_magnitude > thresholds[-1]:  # High surface magnitude
176            # Switch to most aggressive controller (usually Super-Twisting or Adaptive)
177            if 'supertwisting' in self.active_controllers:
178                target = ControllerState.SUPERTWISTING
179                reason = f"High surface magnitude {surface_magnitude:.3f} > {thresholds[-1]:.3f}"
180            elif 'adaptive' in self.active_controllers:
181                target = ControllerState.ADAPTIVE
182                reason = f"High surface magnitude {surface_magnitude:.3f} > {thresholds[-1]:.3f}"
183            else:
184                return None
185
186        elif surface_magnitude < thresholds[0]:  # Low surface magnitude
187            # Switch to classical controller for efficiency
188            if 'classical' in self.active_controllers:
189                target = ControllerState.CLASSICAL
190                reason = f"Low surface magnitude {surface_magnitude:.3f} < {thresholds[0]:.3f}"
191            else:
192                return None
193
194        else:
195            # Medium range - stay with current or use adaptive
196            if 'adaptive' in self.active_controllers and current_controller != 'adaptive':
197                target = ControllerState.ADAPTIVE
198                reason = f"Medium surface magnitude {surface_magnitude:.3f}"
199            else:
200                return None
201
202        if target.value == current_controller:
203            return None
204
205        # Calculate confidence based on how far from threshold
206        distance_from_threshold = min(
207            abs(surface_magnitude - thresh) for thresh in thresholds
208        )
209        max_distance = max(thresholds) - min(thresholds)
210        confidence = min(1.0, distance_from_threshold / max_distance)
211
212        return SwitchingDecision(
213            target_controller=target,
214            reason=reason,
215            confidence=confidence,
216            metrics={'surface_magnitude': surface_magnitude}
217        )
218
219    def _evaluate_control_effort_switching(self, control_results: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
220        """Evaluate switching based on control effort."""
221        current_controller = self.current_controller.value
222
223        if current_controller not in control_results:
224            return None
225
226        control_effort = abs(control_results[current_controller].get('u', 0.0))
227        effort_threshold = self.config.max_force * 0.8  # 80% of max force
228
229        if control_effort > effort_threshold:
230            # High control effort - switch to smoother controller
231            if 'classical' in self.active_controllers and current_controller != 'classical':
232                target = ControllerState.CLASSICAL
233                reason = f"High control effort {control_effort:.3f} > {effort_threshold:.3f}"
234                confidence = min(1.0, (control_effort - effort_threshold) / (self.config.max_force - effort_threshold))
235
236                return SwitchingDecision(
237                    target_controller=target,
238                    reason=reason,
239                    confidence=confidence,
240                    metrics={'control_effort': control_effort}
241                )
242
243        return None
244
245    def _evaluate_tracking_error_switching(self, system_state: np.ndarray) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
246        """Evaluate switching based on tracking error."""
247        tracking_error = self.current_performance_metrics.get('tracking_error', 0.0)
248        error_threshold = 0.1  # Configurable threshold
249
250        if tracking_error > error_threshold:
251            # High tracking error - switch to more aggressive controller
252            current_controller = self.current_controller.value
253
254            if 'supertwisting' in self.active_controllers and current_controller != 'supertwisting':
255                target = ControllerState.SUPERTWISTING
256            elif 'adaptive' in self.active_controllers and current_controller != 'adaptive':
257                target = ControllerState.ADAPTIVE
258            else:
259                return None
260
261            reason = f"High tracking error {tracking_error:.3f} > {error_threshold:.3f}"
262            confidence = min(1.0, tracking_error / (2 * error_threshold))
263
264            return SwitchingDecision(
265                target_controller=target,
266                reason=reason,
267                confidence=confidence,
268                metrics={'tracking_error': tracking_error}
269            )
270
271        return None
272
273    def _evaluate_adaptation_rate_switching(self, control_results: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
274        """Evaluate switching based on adaptation rate (for adaptive controllers)."""
275        current_controller = self.current_controller.value
276
277        if current_controller == 'adaptive' and 'adaptive' in control_results:
278            adaptation_rate = control_results['adaptive'].get('adaptation_rate', 0.0)
279            high_adaptation_threshold = 10.0  # Configurable
280
281            if adaptation_rate > high_adaptation_threshold:
282                # High adaptation rate indicates uncertainty - might switch to Super-Twisting
283                if 'supertwisting' in self.active_controllers:
284                    target = ControllerState.SUPERTWISTING
285                    reason = f"High adaptation rate {adaptation_rate:.3f}"
286                    confidence = min(1.0, adaptation_rate / (2 * high_adaptation_threshold))
287
288                    return SwitchingDecision(
289                        target_controller=target,
290                        reason=reason,
291                        confidence=confidence,
292                        metrics={'adaptation_rate': adaptation_rate}
293                    )
294
295        return None
296
297    def _evaluate_performance_index_switching(self, control_results: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
298        """Evaluate switching based on comprehensive performance index."""
299        current_controller = self.current_controller.value
300
301        # Calculate performance for each available controller
302        controller_performances = {}
303        for controller_name in self.active_controllers:
304            if controller_name in self.performance_history and len(self.performance_history[controller_name]) > 5:
305                recent_performance = list(self.performance_history[controller_name])[-5:]
306                controller_performances[controller_name] = np.mean(recent_performance)
307
308        if len(controller_performances) < 2:
309            return None
310
311        # Find best performing controller
312        best_controller = min(controller_performances.keys(), key=lambda k: controller_performances[k])
313        current_performance = controller_performances.get(current_controller, float('inf'))
314        best_performance = controller_performances[best_controller]
315
316        # Switch if another controller is significantly better
317        improvement_threshold = 0.1  # 10% improvement needed
318        if (best_controller != current_controller and
319            current_performance > best_performance * (1 + improvement_threshold)):
320
321            target = ControllerState(best_controller)
322            improvement = (current_performance - best_performance) / current_performance
323            reason = f"Performance improvement {improvement:.2%} by switching to {best_controller}"
324            confidence = min(1.0, improvement / 0.5)  # Cap at 50% improvement
325
326            return SwitchingDecision(
327                target_controller=target,
328                reason=reason,
329                confidence=confidence,
330                metrics={'performance_improvement': improvement}
331            )
332
333        return None
334
335    def _evaluate_time_based_switching(self, current_time: float) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
336        """Evaluate switching based on time (round-robin or scheduled switching)."""
337        # Simple round-robin switching every 2 seconds
338        switching_period = 2.0
339        controller_index = int(current_time / switching_period) % len(self.active_controllers)
340        target_controller_name = self.active_controllers[controller_index]
341
342        if target_controller_name != self.current_controller.value:
343            target = ControllerState(target_controller_name)
344            reason = f"Time-based switching at t={current_time:.1f}s"
345            confidence = 1.0
346
347            return SwitchingDecision(
348                target_controller=target,
349                reason=reason,
350                confidence=confidence,
351                metrics={'switching_time': current_time}
352            )
353
354        return None
355
356    def _check_hysteresis_condition(self, decision: SwitchingDecision) -> bool:
357        """Check if switching decision passes hysteresis condition."""
358        # Simple hysteresis: require high confidence for switching
359        return decision.confidence > 0.6
360
361    def _apply_predictive_analysis(self, decision: SwitchingDecision, system_state: np.ndarray) -> Optional[SwitchingDecision]:
362        """Apply predictive analysis to switching decision."""
363        # Store current state for prediction
364        if self.prediction_buffer is not None:
365            self.prediction_buffer.append({
366                'state': system_state.copy(),
367                'metrics': self.current_performance_metrics.copy(),
368                'decision': decision
369            })
370
371        # Simple prediction: only switch if trend supports it
372        if len(self.prediction_buffer) >= 3:
373            recent_metrics = [entry['metrics'].get('surface_magnitude', 0)
374                            for entry in list(self.prediction_buffer)[-3:]]
375
376            # Check if trend supports switching decision
377            if decision.target_controller == ControllerState.SUPERTWISTING:
378                # Expect increasing surface magnitude trend
379                trend = np.polyfit(range(len(recent_metrics)), recent_metrics, 1)[0]
380                if trend <= 0:  # Decreasing trend, don't switch to aggressive controller
381                    return None
382            elif decision.target_controller == ControllerState.CLASSICAL:
383                # Expect decreasing surface magnitude trend
384                trend = np.polyfit(range(len(recent_metrics)), recent_metrics, 1)[0]
385                if trend >= 0:  # Increasing trend, don't switch to gentle controller
386                    return None
387
388        return decision
389
390    def _update_learned_thresholds(self, decision: SwitchingDecision, control_results: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
391        """Update learned switching thresholds based on decision outcomes."""
392        if not self.config.enable_learning or self.learned_thresholds is None:
393            return
394
395        # Simple learning: adjust thresholds based on switching success
396        # This would require feedback on switching outcome quality
397        # For now, just record the decision for future analysis
398        self.threshold_adaptation_history.append({
399            'decision': decision,
400            'thresholds': self.learned_thresholds.copy(),
401            'metrics': self.current_performance_metrics.copy()
402        })
403
404    def get_switching_analysis(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
405        """Get comprehensive analysis of switching behavior."""
406        return {
407            'current_controller': self.current_controller.value,
408            'switch_history': self.switch_history[-10:],  # Last 10 switches
409            'performance_history': {
410                controller: list(history)[-20:]  # Last 20 entries
411                for controller, history in self.performance_history.items()
412            },
413            'switching_statistics': self._compute_switching_statistics(),
414            'learned_thresholds': self.learned_thresholds,
415            'configuration': {
416                'criterion': self.config.switching_criterion.value,
417                'thresholds': self.config.switching_thresholds,
418                'hysteresis_margin': self.config.hysteresis_margin,
419                'min_switching_time': self.config.min_switching_time
420            }
421        }
422
423    def _compute_switching_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
424        """Compute statistics about switching behavior."""
425        if not self.switch_history:
426            return {'total_switches': 0}
427
428        # Count switches by controller
429        switch_counts = {}
430        for switch in self.switch_history:
431            from_controller = switch['from']
432            to_controller = switch['to']
433
434            key = f"{from_controller}_to_{to_controller}"
435            switch_counts[key] = switch_counts.get(key, 0) + 1
436
437        # Time between switches
438        switch_times = [switch['time'] for switch in self.switch_history]
439        if len(switch_times) > 1:
440            time_intervals = [switch_times[i+1] - switch_times[i]
441                            for i in range(len(switch_times)-1)]
442            avg_switch_interval = np.mean(time_intervals)
443            std_switch_interval = np.std(time_intervals)
444        else:
445            avg_switch_interval = 0.0
446            std_switch_interval = 0.0
447
448        return {
449            'total_switches': len(self.switch_history),
450            'switch_counts': switch_counts,
451            'avg_switch_interval': avg_switch_interval,
452            'std_switch_interval': std_switch_interval,
453            'most_recent_switch': self.switch_history[-1] if self.switch_history else None
454        }
